did.abstract: David Lilienthal served on the Wisconsin Public Service Commission (1923-1932), as a member of the board of directors (1933-1941) and then chairman (1941-1946) of the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA), as first chairman (1946-1950) of the Atomic Energy Commission, and, later, in private business as an industrial consultant and chairman (1955) of the Development and Resources Corporation, which was involved with the Khuzestan Program in Iran. This collection consists of the papers of Lilienthal spanning his entire career, including correspondence, reports, articles, speeches, and printed matter.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: For preservation reasons, original analog and digital media may not be read or played back in the reading room. Users may visually inspect physical media but may not remove it from its enclosure. All analog audiovisual media must be digitized to preservation-quality standards prior to use. Audiovisual digitization requests are processed by an approved third-party vendor. Please note, the transfer time required can be as little as several weeks to as long as several months and there may be financial costs associated with the process. Requests should be directed through the Ask Us Form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Lilienthal spanning his entire career. Included are correspondence, reports, articles, speeches, and printed matter relating to his positions with the Wisconsin Public Service Commission (1923-1932), as a member of the board of directors (1933-1941) and then chairman (1941-1946) of the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA), as first chairman (1946-1950) of the Atomic Energy Commission, and, later, in private business as an industrial consultant and chairman (1955) of the Development and Resources Corporation, which was involved with the Khuzestan Program in Iran. Also present are manuscripts for six works, including TVA, Democracy on the March (1944), Big Business, A New Era (1953), Atomic Energy, A New Start (1980), and the published Journals of David E. Lilienthal, Vols. I-VII, 1939-1981 (1964-1983), as well as his personal, unpublished, manuscript journals (1915-1981).

Other personal papers include documents, early correspondence (1917-1923) with his future wife, Helen Lamb, and other family members, appointment books, scrapbooks, film and tape recordings, photographs, and memorabilia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials in this collection may have been put in this order by Lilienthal or his administrative staff before transfer to Princeton, and further arrangement may have been done by an archivist at Princeton but no information is available regarding the extent to which an archivist was involved in the current arrangement. In 2019 a number of materials after series 22 were rehoused and merged with corresponding series into series 8, 10-13, and 25. Other series that are are broken up in in two, including speeches and correspondence, are left intact.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The original collection was a gift from David E. Lilienthal in 1965. Several additions to the collection were received over the next two decades, the last one for which documentation exists was in July 1987. Amendments to the original 1965 Deed of Gift allow access to previously restricted materials.
Additional family correspondence was added to the collection in 2022. The accessions associated with this material are ML-2019-022 and ML-2021-002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 1: Articles, books, and lecture notes includes articles and books written by Lilienthal from 1918-1949 and lecture notes from Lilienthal's time at law school.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials in this series are arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 18: Correspondence and Related Materials consists of mostly professional correspondence to and from Lilienthal from 1905 to 1981. Some correspondence relates to particular subjects and are labeled as such (e.g., Argentina) rather than as correspondence to or from a particular individual.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials in this series are arranged in chronological order by the last name of the correspondent or subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence and related material for 1977 and 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials in this subseries are arranged in chronological order by year and within each year alphabetically by last name of correspondent or subject.
